text: The Gulf of Mexico fringed sole (Gymnachirus texae), also known as the Fringed sole,Common names of Gymnachirus texae at www.fishbase.org. is a species of sole in the family Achiridae. It was described by Gordon Gunter in 1936, originally under the genus Nodogymnus. It is known from the United States and Mexico. It dwells at a depth range of .Gymnachirus texae at the IUCN redlist. It reaches a maximum total length of . The Gulf of Mexico fringed sole is currently ranked as Least Concern by the IUCN redlist, although it makes note that part of its range was affected by the Deepwater Horizon oil spill in 2010. It is sometimes harvested as bycatch by shrimp trawls. ==References== Category:Pleuronectiformes Category:Fish described in 1936 Category:Taxa named by Gordon Gunter
title: Gulf of Mexico fringed sole
